snippet: The carmaker installed emissions-cheating software in 2008 after realizing that a new diesel motor could not meet pollution standards, people familiar with an internal inquiry said.
abstract: Volkswagen started installing software made to cheat on emissions tests in 2008 after discovering that new, expensive diesel engine would not meet pollution criteria in United States and other countries; revelation has tarnished Germany's reputation for excellent engineering and will force Volkswagen to make costly repairs on up to 11 million vehicles.

byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The carmaker installed emissions-cheating software in 2008 after realizing that a new diesel motor could not meet pollution standards, people familiar with an internal inquiry said.

headline.main: Volkswagen Engine-Rigging Scheme Said to Have Begun in 2008
headline.print_headline: VW Engine-Rigging Scheme Said to Have Begun in 2008
